findings.title: Use of flashloan lending to get more discount
Fees can be manipulated maliciously
findings.description: In swapETHForExactTokens() and swapExactETHForTokens(), a malicious user can pass a very small amountIn so that the calculated app fee would be zero or close to zero.

findings.title: swapExactETHToUSDCForConversion() doesn't take amountOutMin
findings.description: The function swapExactETHToUSDCForConversion() does not consider the minimum amount of output tokens that must be received, making it possible for a malicious actor to front-run the transaction and cause the user to receive an unexpectedly low amount of tokens.

findings.title: Dust/extra matic amount should be sent back to the user
findings.description: The contract does not return dust or extra MATIC amounts to the user.

findings.title: Fee can be decreased close to zero
findings.description: In swapETHForExactTokens(), swapExactETHForTokens() malicious user can pass a very small amountIn so that the calculated app fee would be zero or close to zero.
